result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Esequiel Perez

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Status conference on January 17, 2023 at 09:15 am.
Court entered not guilty plea for defendant. Motions due 20 days. Bail continued.

2:34 PM Defendant Esequiel Perez in court.  Attorney Jamie J Pagac in court for Esequiel Perez.  Attorney Tess Lewandowski in court for State of Wisconsin. Interpreter Jim Larson in court. State calls witness J. Z. who is duly sworn and testified. Atty. Lewandowski with direct. Witness identified DE in courtroom. Atty. Pagac with direct. State moves for bindover, reserves argument. Atty. Pagac objects, waives argument. Court finds PC for BO to branch.
Case scheduled for prelim at the request of defense counsel.  Defense also indicted defendant will need Spanish interpreter; case updated.
Preliminary hearing on November 3, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 045593,
Payable Number: 576148,
Receipt Number: 22RS040965,
Amount: $20.00

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
- Defendant shall not be at any McFarland School District property.
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 13

1:23 PM Defendant Esequiel Perez in court, in custody.  Attorney Jonathan A. LaVoy in court for Esequiel Perez.  Prosecuting attorney Thersa Louise Lewandowski in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on October 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
